website_summaries.verdict: An entry level model from an impressive line of water timers produced by Orbit. Recommended for basic watering needs such as lawn care or drip irrigation. Very attractive retail price point and strong company reputation make it worthy of consideration.
pros: Simple one-dial programming allows for 2 to 90 minutes of watering
Can be set to start every day, or up to every three days
Fits standard hose or faucet fittings
cons: Very basic operation, without a rain delay option
Users report some internal leakage issues and "water hammering."
Not ideal for projects requiring complicated watering schedules

customer_reviews.title: I put brand new batteries in it. It worked ...
customer_reviews.text: I put brand new batteries in it. It worked the first night. The second time I tried it my whole house started shaking. I finally figured out it was this thing. Apparently it could not close the value all the way. It made the water pulsate very violently for some reason and shook the pipes. I kept trying but the same thing kept happening. It would open the value but when it was time to shut it off it could not do so. So I returned this. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brandano

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say I recommend that you DON’T BUY this product. Unfortunately I ordered two timers only three months ago for a new sprinkler system and both have stopped working. They worked fine then started going off at odd times for a few days now they totally stopped working. Put in new batteries but nothing helps.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Babboni

customer_reviews.title: Most versatile and cost effective timer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this timer because I had some big fancy Rain Bird timer with a bunch of settings, but no ability to do exactly what I wanted. I wanted a timer that was easy to change, but had the ability to do every other day or every third day watering. Most of the timers I've had you had to schedule by the day of the week, so there was always uneven watering because of a seven day watering cycle. This timer is so easy to change days or durations to fit my garden and trees needs. It lasted well through one season, I hope it lasts many more.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Will

customer_reviews.title: Good hearty timers
customer_reviews.text: I love these timers I have a hobbie farm and a small orchard 3 small pastures. All watered with these timers. Tough easy to repair simple pretty darn tough I have about 30. I leave them on all year battery life good about 5 months on good batterys daily use. I do insulate well I make envelopes out of bubble foil. Honestly I beat these timers. Save warn ones use for parts to repair others . Bullet proof.
customer_reviews.author: brendon

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, set and forget.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that there is no clock to get destroyed because it is so close to water, and as we all know, water and electronics don't play well together. The clock starts when you install the battery, whatever that is. Also, when you reset the unit, at that time the clock will also reset. The battery lasts for the entire season. So, replace it every season. It's totally mechanical which is excellent around water!
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purposely waited until 7:00 pm. I installed two brand new batteries and set it to run for 15 mins every day. It did not turn on so I hand watered thinking it would start at 7pm the next night. Some time during the night the timer turned on the sprinkler. I found it running at 6am this morning and obviously had been running SEVERAL hours. I bought it to water a small garden while away on vacation. I cannot trust it will turn on or off as it should. It is completely useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver! When I traveled, I had to either pay someone to water my plants or come home to dead ones. This works great! I attached it to my sprinkler and set the time for one hour and it worked great! The most difficult part of using it was positioning your hose/sprinkler to cover the area I wanted covered. So now I don't have to pay someone to take care of my plants while I'm gone, or even while I'm here and feel too lazy to go out to water :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for vacation watering
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install and set. Takes two batteries so those go fast if it's cold or hot but it still works wonderfully. I have mine attached to two hoses and they both have plenty of pressure without leaking at the outlet. I love the options to have daily, or every other day, as we have restrictions in the summer, so I don't have to mess with it. So far it's lasted 2 years and it will be attached for another summer this year.
customer_reviews.author: West

customer_reviews.title: Simple hose timer, won't last long.
customer_reviews.text: Ya know I have gone through 8 of these in the last 6 years, for various applications around my off-grid homestead. I have rarely gotten more than a year of use from them. The last one the solenoid would not completely shut off, so it overflowed and caused damage. Took it apart, could not repair. I was always addicted to the simple nature of these, but I am trying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: zozomike

customer_reviews.title: This is such a simple and great product. I use this device for drip irrigation ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such a simple and great product. I use this device for drip irrigation to an area that I do not have a sprinkler drip zone. The time can be set to water daily, every other day or every third day. Just like having a sprinkler zone set up. Set it and forget it. I have mine set t water daily for 5 minutes. Great price too! I'm going to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: G. Patten

customer_reviews.title: Mine didn't work, so I returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't work (water wouldn't come out), so I returned it. They didn't have any more, so I got a different model, but this one would have suited me if it had worked. The big drawback to these Orbit timers is the immediate cut-off, which causes a water-hammer, so you also have to pay $15-20 for an arrestor. Figure that cost in.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Crutchfield

customer_reviews.title: Easy simple to use!
customer_reviews.text: It's so simple, you put batteries in it. Put it on your hose spigot. MAKE SURE YOU LEAVE A STRESS LOOP! if you pull on it hard you will certainly break it! And when you want the lawn watered, just turn the timer knob to the length of time you want it to water. That's it! And it will come on at the same time every day. It worked flawlessly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little timer. It's simplicity is it's biggest advantage for me. You just set how long you want the water to run, and you walk away. If you want it to run every day, or every other day, or every third day, you just point the dial at the right place and that's it. I don't have to learn or remember how to program anything, or keep track of instructions. I like it enough that I've already ordered a second one.
customer_reviews.author: EDSON A FREEMAN

customer_reviews.title: Never worked properly and no way to see if it is active
customer_reviews.text: Once the batteries are in place and the dial is turned to the setting one wants for the watering interval there is no way to see if the timer is actually working. The timer never came on and when I removed the hose from the outlet of the timer it was completely dry. I replaced it with a mechanical timer.
customer_reviews.author: WinterTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good timer irrigation controller but limited featues
customer_reviews.text: Almost all orbit products work well but the lower priced battery powered timer controllers have limited start times and run times so understand tou should buy the pro or best models if you want to use the timer controller say, 3 times per day, 5am, 11am, 3pm for 10 mins, 8 mins and 5 mins...because you cannot make that adjustment with the lower priced models.
customer_reviews.author: Buy allot of stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great if you need to irrigate no more than once per day
customer_reviews.text: It's very simple to use, doesn't leak, solid connector made of brass, decent water flow, battery lasts longer than other LCD timers. Only drawback it can turn on once per day max. This not an issue for my balcony drip irrigation, but not suitable for misting or if you want to irrigate your garden several times per day.
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have another one of these and they are really easy to use. My only complaint is that the other one came with batteries and this one didn't. But they're super easy to set. The batteries are easy to install. I'd buy them again. I prefer them over the more expensive ones with fancy features.
customer_reviews.author: TeresaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: easy set up and worked great for the first month, my garden was thriving with minimal intervention on my part. then we had 3 days of heavy rains and the battery socket rusted out and it stopped working. Lame for what is supposed to be used outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle B

customer_reviews.title: I love these things
customer_reviews.text: Have 5 of them now. Really useful...I was always forgetting to turn off. Very easy to use. So far no issues with leaking or battery life. They are mostly plastic, so be cautious with hose...you can't pull it. I keep an extra wrap around the hose holder to protect them.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Creates water hammer
customer_reviews.text: This timer uses a fast acting solenoid-type valve that slams open and slams shut. This causes water hammer (banging pipes). Not all timers have this type of valve and don't do this. Otherwise the thing works as advertised. Simple. I'm going to get a water hammer arrestor to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Good value but cannot water twice a day
customer_reviews.text: The timer works good. I wish it had the option of watering twice a day (recommended to grow new grass). I have to walk outside at least four times a day to start the timer and cut of the water because it leaks sometimes and I want to leave my water spigots turned on 24/7. I am now looking at digital timers but they all seem to have bad reviews.
customer_reviews.author: D.Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very Reliable and Easy to Use.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this timer all summer long for my garden and it worked like a champ. It is easy to setup and easy to use. It never malfunctioned or missed a day of watering. The module valve kicks on and off letting water flow well enough to run a couple of sprinkler. The timer is easy to read. The dark, plastic cover that goes over it protects it from the weather, so there was no fading on the labels or weather on the controls. I have put it up for the winter but plan to use it again next spring.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua McCorkle

customer_reviews.title: Good and works well, but has limitations.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, however, be aware that you cannot select the timer start time on this unit. The timer starts when you select the water run-time (i.e. 5 minutes, 10 minutes, 15 minutes, etc. This makes it difficult to setup because you have to turn it on at the time of day that you want the water to run (i.e. set it up at 11 AM if you want the water on at 11 AM every day). That is kind of annoying. Otherwise, it works as advertised. Just make sure you know that it has its limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Sands

customer_reviews.title: Read this before you buy. You could hate this timer.
customer_reviews.text: This timer has one huge fault. It's time of day is set to whenever you made the last adjustment. There is one dial that selects the interval, off, manual operation etc. So, for example, you set the dial to run one hour everyday, but you want this to happen at 6am. You actually have to turn the dial to that selection AT 6 AM. Later you have added a new sprinkler and need to check the coverage. You turn the dial to manual, but now you've just lost your 6am program. Some programmer and their supervisor missed the boat on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Pollyanna

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Buy it! Purchased mine 11/2014, almost four years old and working like a champ, hope I didn't just jinx myself. Use it year round and only replaced the batteries once that I remember and that was this year. I use it outside during the summer and move it inside with my potted plants for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great product at an even better price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this attached for a few weeks now and it has worked great. It goes on at the time of day that you set it. It took a week or so to perfect the drip irrigation/timing/amount combination, but once that was figured out, I haven’t had to think about it all.
customer_reviews.author: Renee B.

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install on my hose and a straight forward ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Orbit Watering unit because I was going out of town and needed something simple and inexpensive and I needed it quickly. It was easy to install on my hose and a straight forward set-up. The only downside to this is, you have to set the timer at the time of day when you want the timer to go off. For example, if you want the sprinkler to start at 9am, you must be at the dial at 9am to set the timer. Not a big deal. You also have the option of watering everyday, every other day, or every 3rd day. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Earwig paradise!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best earwig farm I've ever found. There's easy access to ample room inside for a whole nest of full-sized earwigs, including their eggs and babies; in fact, small spiders can even find room to coexist with such a roomy interior. A lack of weather seal allows ample water to flow through to help your arthropods thrive. It also sometimes does timed watering, until it doesn't and just leaves the valve open so you can drown your entire garden with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel E. Walizer

customer_reviews.title: Quality and reliability
customer_reviews.text: Use them all over the property with good success. So very easy to program. We use 4 in 1 faucet adapters to use in those areas that are hard to reach. Several have been place for 4 years. Batteries last 3-4 months.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Absolute waste of money - not just for the timer
customer_reviews.text: In theory, this should be an ideal water timer - in theory! Fact is, I should have heeded other reviewers complaining about the reliability. Intermittent problems - at first (about 3 weeks in), followed by total chaos! This thing has stopped completely after less than 6 weeks use. Absolute waste of money - not just for the timer, but the water than ran for at least one full day! What a disaster!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Barnard

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use no programing - happy happy
customer_reviews.text: We have a small water feature/rocks and ferns that has been 'fed' from the drip system on a timer. I think plant roots have invaded and are now drinking the water as I have to add extra daily. There is a hose bib right above the feature than I put the Orbit on and it works perfectly. No need to program just turn the dial to how many pre determined minutes and daily/every other or every 3rd day at the time you want it to come on. Easy peasy :-)
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: After trying a couple other manual hose timers, I decided to upgrade to a digital version and couldn’t be happier with it. It’s a “set it and forget it” type of product. I’ve had it on for about a month now and haven’t had any issues with battery or watering schedule.
customer_reviews.author: markro87

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hook up and use. I bought this to use when we were on vacation. My plants were in great shape when we returned. It’s been a dry summer but with this timer I never forget to water.
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia

customer_reviews.title: it's working!
customer_reviews.text: Put one on the front hose and one on the back to regulate soaker hose use during drought restrictions. They seem to work great. They're easy to set. They have limited settings offering daily, every other day and every third day. Once a week would be a nice addition. Beware that the moment you set it, it starts watering and will meet the schedule from that moment for the setting you picked. You can't say "starting tomorrow, water every 3 days for 30 mins" once you set it, it starts and the timer starts from that moment.
customer_reviews.author: Puffero

customer_reviews.title: Quality is getting worse and worse
customer_reviews.text: Used to love these timers. I have purchased over 8 of them. However, the last three have failed within two weeks of getting them. The electronics seem to be the issue. Two of the three stopped responding to the program and won’t open the valve either on ON position or with the timer set. Th e third one’s programming is messed up and regardless on how you set the timer, it is going to water twice a day no matter what. So buyer’s beware that quality is NOT what it used to be
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more struggling to program a timer
customer_reviews.text: Just set it for what you want. No struggling to program start/stop, duration, etc. times. May not be as flexible as the complicated models, but for most watering tasks works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Bates

customer_reviews.title: Almost archaic it has so few options to do anything
customer_reviews.text: Only allows watering once a day and you can’t even set the time when you want that to happen! Whenever you are setting up the timer to run the very few options of 5, 10, 15 min a day, week or month, that’s when it will run. So few options it’s almost worthless. If it wasn’t for a garden bed in the shade, it would not work at all for me.
customer_reviews.author: JeanDucksfan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little unit.
customer_reviews.text: These work great, own several. Never had a problem with them. Kept the pool full all summer and simple enough my 2nd grader could use it without issue.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Good manual hose timer
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. I use it to run my soaker hose in my veggie garden. Took awhile to 'fine tune' it for flow and time, but once I got that figured out, it does what I bought it to do when I want it done. When I rains I have to shut if Off until the next time the garden needs to be watered so without a rain sensor I can say it's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Worked for awhile.
customer_reviews.text: This timer worked as described however it only lasted one month and then it was rusted out and would not work any longer. I attribute this mostly to the fact that my water has iron in it. If you're planning to use this with well water that has iron in it you need to reconsider how long this might last you. It is important to understand that this timer turns on at the very same time every day as the very last time you've manually turned it on. It does not have a clock or an hour setting on it
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca R.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable timer kept my garden watered while I was on vacation!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so my garden could be watered during a week long vacation. As others have said, setup of the timer is a little inconvenient, but in my case, it was no big deal since I'm always up early anyway. Take note that the first water session starts immediately after you set the timer! I didn't have any issues with leaks, changes in water pressure, water hammer, etc that some other reviewers noted. It worked exactly as expected. Seems well made and should last a while. My only issue with this product was the price - it seems a bit expensive, but after researching all of the alternative products, it was one of the least expensive options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Connections are good and not leaking. Note that there is about a 5-second delay anytime you change the timer setting, or even just switch it between 'on' and 'off.' Also, and this is noted in the manual, you cannot specify the time of day the timer gets set for - It will turn on each day at the exact time you set it. So if you want it set for 4am, you're going to have to get up at 4am and set it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E.

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied with Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: We bought this timer in conjunction with the purchase of an oscillating sprinkler system. The timer has worked perfectly. We are very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Action/Suspense Fan

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor timer
customer_reviews.text: This item was a big disappointment. I say that because it was fine at first and then just started leaking. I think because it is plastic. Plastic is just not good on outside spickets. Save your money and get one that is NOT plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Clark

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for several weeks now and it works perfectly. This is a very simple unit to use, just turn it on when you want it to start and it will come each day at he same time()s. Have not had any problems with leaks and no water has infiltrated into the unit. Satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Simple but effective
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new one of these to replace an identical one that I have been using for 4 years. The old one still works, but developed some minor leaks. At this price I will be pleased if the new one gives me 4 years of service
customer_reviews.author: SamBrad

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: It turns on at the same time it is first set, meaning that if you turn it on at 3am and set it to 30 minutes daily it will continue to water at 3am for 30 minutes. Absolutely a great value for keeping our yard nice and green.
customer_reviews.author: The mama

customer_reviews.title: Digital watering timer
customer_reviews.text: Leaked right away with first use. Didn't matter how much I tightened. I even tried different washers but to no avail. Very disappointed. Sadly, I purchased two of these and never opened the second one.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: reliable (for me); easy set up
customer_reviews.text: been running for almost two years now. lately been running it every other day for 5 minutes for my lawn and timer has been accurate enough. the only con is that you have to manually set it at the time that you want it to run, but, simple is good in my book too (as less things to break).
customer_reviews.author: DanTheMan

customer_reviews.title: Easy-to-use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set-up and use. Only thing I didn't like was that you have to turn it on at the time you want it to go on the first time. So if you want to change the time it goes off to a later time you have to wait and change it.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Daniel Robinson

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great watering timer
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great watering timer. I went on 3 -1 week long vacations and I didn't want my small garden to die while I was away. I set the timer to water for 30 minutes everyday and it worked flawlessly. After each vacation my plants were well watered and thriving. It was a huge relief not to have to ask a neighbor to water my plants everyday while I was away. Did everything I wanted it to do. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Havey

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest I could find and does exactly what it is supposed to. Some of the plastic feels a bit iffy, but for the price it's expected. Runs off of batteries and has been very reliable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Simple is Good....
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for several years. They are simple, and work great. The only drawback is you can choose only the lenghts of time for watering that is shown on the timer; for example, there is 15 minutes, then it jumps to 30 minutes. So, if you need 20 minutes, you need another kind of timer.
customer_reviews.author: redninja

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I needed a simple and easy to use timer for flowers at my mother in-laws home. I set it once and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Chucko

customer_reviews.title: 2 stars for the amount of years it lasted before ...
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars for the amount of years it lasted before breaking. I contacted customer support and they never got back to me, whereas Melnor has a 7 year warranty on their timers and have replaced two without delay with attached pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm, my garden is hydrated and happy thanks to the Orbit timer! So easy to adjust, just have to remember to turn it on at the desired time if I change it.I didn't want to mess with digital settings and this is fool-proof.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Just purchased a second.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these 4-5 years ago. I needed one on other side of the house so bought another. Both are still fully operational. Great timer.
customer_reviews.author: citizenforchange

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly. Great warranty service
customer_reviews.text: Read the other reviews and decided to go with this model when I had 3 asst timers fail. When I received my order I read that it had a 5year warranty. One of my broken timers was the same brand so I called the number listed and asked if it was covered by a warranty as well. They could not have been nicer. After looking up the model number of the unit I had they said yes and sent me a replacement that I received about 4 days later. Amazing service. I highly recommend this company and can only believe I am set with my 3 new timers for the next 5 years
customer_reviews.author: marilyn s

customer_reviews.title: Great timer
customer_reviews.text: I used this timer all summer with no problems. Easy to adjust, and run all summer on the original batteries. I am hoping to get many more years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Powlus

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year since I installed this timer and I'm now writing a review. I haven't had any issues and it works great. My garden growing better than ever not having to worry about watering. I do turn it off during winter months where the plants need less water
customer_reviews.author: John l

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective, and low cost
customer_reviews.text: I've used a variety of similar timers through the years with a few houses on 20 acres, and this is easily the simplest to set and use. It isn't fancy, but if you want to water up to 90 minutes every 3rd day (60 minutes every [other] day) it is as simple as turning the dial to make it run then, and every target day at that time thereafter. Time will tell on durability, but as simple as the design is, one would expect it to be pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: CompletelyComputers

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: So simple to use. I have 7 of them in my vegetable garden, one in each grow box.
customer_reviews.author: cheri dibble

customer_reviews.title: This Timer Makes Life Easier
customer_reviews.text: Houston is in a draught and watering the lawn has been important (when it's allowed). This is an easy to use timer that has worked consistantly. I'm able to turn it on before leaving for work and know it will turn off on time. In hindsight, I will I had ordered a timer that allowed one time usage. Since there is every other day and every 3rd day options, I have to remember to turn the knob to the "off" position before the other day or 3rd day arrives since I'm only watering once a week. A great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette

customer_reviews.title: Best hose timer on the market
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set and easy to use. Durable and uncomplicated.
customer_reviews.author: Doobahjay

customer_reviews.title: Good but don't let it freeze
customer_reviews.text: I want to give it a higher rating but was really hoping for something that wouldn't get damaged with freezing temperatures. Maybe I'm asking too much. Worked well before it froze. Well, at least I think it's the freezing temps that damaged it. I can't be sure. I'm looking elsewhere to see if I can find something that handles freezing temps.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: I like to set my timer to start at around 6
customer_reviews.text: I like to set my timer to start at around 6:00 a.m.; that doesn't mean I like to wake up at 6:00 and remember to reset the timer after manual watering. If you are an early bird this probably won't be an issue for you, but as a night owl it is a huge one for me. Also, water started spraying out from the device only after using it twice. Using plumbers tape did not help because it is spraying out below the area that screws into the spigot.
customer_reviews.author: coco

customer_reviews.title: Best watering timer ever
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my vegetable garden. It replaces one that had seen better days. Works great. Very flexible. You might think the lack of a clock would be an issue, but this makes it simpler to use and less likely to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, but needs to be right side up
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to hook up and set the timer. BUT one of our spigots points up, so I needed to install this upside down. When I turned the water on, it spewed out through the connections. I tightened them all as far as I could, but there was still spewing. My conclusion is that this timer can only be installed right side up! I plan on getting a short leader hose and trying to rig something up that way...
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good price and works well. It will run on the schedule from when you turn it on. So if you turn it on at 7am in the morning then it will kick off 7am from now on every morning. I use the 2 minute timer since I want little water daily instead of selecting every other day. Its a good deal though and protected from water.
customer_reviews.author: AndyHouston

customer_reviews.title: Saved our plants!
customer_reviews.text: Went on vacation for a month, installed two lithium AA batteries, attached timer to drip-hose and hose bib, and then set the timer for daily watering (very easy to do). Returned and all was well, plants were thriving (despite 100 degree temps while gone) and timer was operating just as we left it. I used lithium batteries because we were going away for a month and did not know if alkaline would last in the heat. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: T. cruzi

customer_reviews.title: Good BASIC watering
customer_reviews.text: Works well as described, but I'm disappointed there is no way to water twice a day (which I knew it didn't, but after getting it set up and working thought might be a better way since a longer watering just results in runoff)..
customer_reviews.author: Kae Bender - Editor and Writer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to figure out how to program
customer_reviews.text: Great price and Orbit has good products. This one does not come with instructions that make sense to me on how to set it. I have to go to UTube and watch a video every time I need to set on. So if that doesn’t bother you it’s a great product. Study, easy to install etc
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it. simple and easy to use and setup
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Not working at all. I put in new batteries and turn it on and it doesn't work. ☹️ There's nothing that could be wrong with my setup: I turn on water and turn on the unit, but the valve doesn't open.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica D

customer_reviews.title: First time today didn't used until today don't work. ...
customer_reviews.text: First time today didn't used until today don't work. Water comming out behind hook up . Turn on sent 4 2 min. Water keep comming out
customer_reviews.author: Takoman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is our third set of timers.. Yes, we like them very much. Easy to setup, very straight forward and reliable. It saves me time and having to remember to turn on sprinklers, and then remember to turn them off.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: good low cost alternative for automatic watering
customer_reviews.text: Bought 6 of these this summer. Very easy to set up and no problems so far. These are a good low cost alternative for automatic watering when your watering needs fall between 15 minutes daily and 90 minutes every 3 days with lots of choices in between. I use them for my lawn and gardens. For watering newly seeded lawn sections, for example, where watering several times daily is required, I use a more expensive fully programmable timer. But for the bulk of my watering needs, the Orbit 62024 timers do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: This timer works great. I have it set to run daily for ...
customer_reviews.text: This timer works great. I have it set to run daily for 30 minutes and it has run flawlessly on the 2 AA batteries for nearly 2 months now. Whatever you set (every day or every other day, etc and 2 minutes to 90 minutes) there is no clock. Just set the cycle you want and then start it at the time you want it to start. It will repeat automatically.
customer_reviews.author: BRET GRAHAM

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Unit
customer_reviews.text: We used two of these units to keep our gardens watered last summer. They're easy to setup and worked reliably. The batteries lasted the whole season. The only comment is that when they turn on and off, it bangs the pipes pretty hard. Just don't set your on/off times for when you're trying to sleep!
customer_reviews.author: Zipperman

customer_reviews.title: It's the only hose timer I'll use. I've bought ...
customer_reviews.text: It's the only hose timer I'll use. I've bought a dozen other types and they just end up breaking and over-watering my lawn or not working at all. I bought a second one after using the first for 2 months. I have one on my front yard and another in the back. The price is reasonable and the unit is reliable. Simple to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Besafe

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, it would be nice to set the time of day to come on rather than run on 24hr time from moment of setting.
customer_reviews.author: Terry King

customer_reviews.title: No nagging needed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 10 holly bushes and 3 trees to plant along our property line. We'd ask each other did you remember to turn the water on/off ? To protect our investment we needed to water the shrubberies to keep them alive. This little timer worked great! It is simple to use and does the trick. Turns on the water daily, every other day or every third day and no nagging required.
customer_reviews.author: Nalo

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this time works great. I wish it had more functions but for $10, this will work.
customer_reviews.author: ACE

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for a drip irrigation line that runs around my property.
customer_reviews.author: Jonner

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept, but it leaks
customer_reviews.text: This is a great concept, and I had high hopes that it would work, but it constantly leaks when the timer shuts off the water. Unfortunately, by the time I used the item for the very first time, the time limit on returns had expired (I bought it ahead of time for planting grass seed in the fall).
customer_reviews.author: madcamper

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. It is very simple and easy to use. Just make sure that you set it up at the time that you want to water.
customer_reviews.author: ned j. augustyniak

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for about 3 seasons. I wish it ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about 3 seasons. I wish it had lasted longer, but I used it for about 6 months out of the year, stayed hooked up 24/7. It's reasonable it wouldn't last forever.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Southern Woman of a Certain Age

customer_reviews.title: Good timer for the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so that I could water my small garden while away from home for several days. The trick is to make sure you start the timer at the time of day you want it to water (it does not have a digital clock setting). However for the money it did the job very well. When I got home I found that it kept the garden watered as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but worth a few dollars more for extra options
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly satisfied with the timer. It works just fine. The only issue is that if you are using it for an application that requires less frequent watering for short periods of time, you'll want to spend the extra money for a higher end model. Fine, not great.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Lake

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly for our small garden, while home or away.
customer_reviews.text: This water timer allows for a small amount of time for the small watering needs, or adjusts higher for our larger gardening needs. I just set the timer, turn the water pressure to where I want and it will water at that time each day. If you don't need water every day, you can set it for every other day, or every third day. I'm very happy with this item for the price.
customer_reviews.author: K & P Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Too little pressure once attached.
customer_reviews.text: Intent was to use it on a timer to water the lawn. The electrical component appeared to work alternately, but either the filter and/or the small circumference of the internal hole the water flows through in it limited the pressure enough that it wasn't functional.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Requires high pressure
customer_reviews.text: I could not use these for the project I had purchased them for. I wanted to use them on a gravity feed system, but it didn't have enough pressure to activate the valve. I never ended up using them, so I don't know how well they work.
customer_reviews.author: Online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit my needs
customer_reviews.text: It assumes that you want to set up an automatic water schedule. Read the image carefully. I wanted options to water manually as well as on a schedule
customer_reviews.author: JWP

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried when reading some of the reviews, but really, I just plugged everything in, and then before I left for work one morning set it for the 10 minutes I wanted. It turned on every day, just like it is supposed to do. It didn't drip when it was supposed to be off. It worked just like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Cmpdx

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set and I like the cover on it. Has lasted the entire year.
customer_reviews.author: Maryland

customer_reviews.title: Great for irrigation lines
customer_reviews.text: Have this going on my raised garden bed. It's working out great. May wire a solar panel to it in the future like I've seen others mention. There's no real indication of when the battery is dead unless you test it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Schrum

customer_reviews.title: Simple, low cost timer.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working well where I use it in my garden on a daily basis. The operation is so simple that is confusing. When setting is up, all you do is go to the unit at the time of day you want it to run on your schedule and set the duration. Then it repeats that schedule regularly.
customer_reviews.author: WJM

customer_reviews.title: Broke a few days after the warranty expired. Not good for rain catchment.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this timer because it seemed simple to use and doesn't have digital readouts that can go bad. I had it connected to a cistern while I went on tour for the summer. Water leaks significantly out of the timer connections (not the hose, the actual timer) and thus drained my 550 gallon cistern while I was gone. I tested it again to verify that it was a leaky unit and sure enough, it is. It is now going to the landfill since the warranty had just barely expired.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Off-Gridder

customer_reviews.title: Easy to program!
customer_reviews.text: I love tbis product! Works great. East to use. Better than the digital ones.
customer_reviews.author: tazzygirl

customer_reviews.title: This timer is extremely easy to set
customer_reviews.text: This timer is extremely easy to set, just turn the dial. You do not set the time on this one. If you set it for 15 min. daily, it will start watering the next day at the time that you set it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Young
